intro: Erigeron bonplandii, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron bonplandii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
